title: Pseudoachondroplasia: Birth Prevalence and Demographics
short_description: Clinical document providing epidemiological data on pseudoachondroplasia, including birth prevalence estimates and gender distribution.
long_description: This clinical research document presents key epidemiological information about pseudoachondroplasia, a rare genetic skeletal disorder. The document reports that while the exact birth prevalence remains unknown, current estimates suggest the condition affects approximately 1 in 50,000 to 100,000 births. The document also notes that pseudoachondroplasia shows no gender bias, affecting males and females equally. This information is valuable for healthcare professionals, genetic counselors, and researchers working with rare skeletal dysplasias.
